pros.description: The location is silent, relaxing, and free from significant noise or disturbances.
Aesthetic appeal of the surrounding landscape, nature, and environment.
Excellent visibility for sunsets or low light pollution for stargazing.
Personal interactions with owners or employees are positive and welcoming.
Staff can communicate in multiple languages or go out of their way to assist international guests.
Provision of valuable advice about the surrounding area, hidden gems, or specific navigation.
Sanitary blocks, kitchens, or common areas are in good repair and hygienic.
Showers provide reliable hot water and strong water flow.
Washing machines and dryers are present and work correctly.
Individual parking spots are large and offer privacy from neighbors.
The parking surface is even and does not require significant leveling of the vehicle.
Trees or structures provide protection from direct sunlight.
The cost of the stay is perceived as a good deal or reasonably priced.
The location accepts camping discount cards like ACSI.
Costs are clearly stated without hidden fees or complex calculations.
Direct or very close access to a beach, lake, or river.
Walking or short distance to shops, restaurants, and town amenities.
Proximity to hiking paths, forest trails, or cycling routes.
Nearby availability of groceries, gas stations, or hardware stores.
Fresh bread can be ordered or is delivered to the site in the morning.
Availability of prepared food or drinks directly on the property.
Power hookups are stable and provide sufficient amperage.
Clean drinking water is easily accessible for refilling tanks.
Working stations for emptying grey water and chemical toilets.
The site provides a fast and stable wireless internet connection.
Excellent cellular data reception (4G/5G) across the site.
Physical security measures like fences, gates, or cameras are present.
Subjective feeling of safety due to the neighborhood or other guests.
The site welcomes dogs and may provide bins, showers, or exercise areas.
Safe spaces or equipment for children to play.
The entrance and internal roads are suitable for long or heavy motorhomes.
24/7 access via machines or easy self-check-in without waiting for staff.
Recreational options like swimming pools or organized classes.
The place has a distinct artistic, ecological, or rural character.
Availability of specialized gas refilling services on or near site.
Opportunities to interact with animals, gardens, or sustainable projects.
The site is near historical monuments or has cultural significance.
Parking is not an official campsite, but authorities are known to overlook overnight stays without fines.
Explicit gratitude or positive mention of the local municipality for providing and supporting the area.
Essential utilities like water or electricity are available directly at the individual parking spot.
Exceptional darkness at night, making the location ideal for stargazing.
Ability to buy local farm goods, wine, or crafts directly from the source.
Self-service kiosks support multiple languages, making check-in easier for international travelers.
Any other positive feedback that does not fit into specific categories.

cons.description: Significant noise pollution from nearby roads, flight paths, or railways.
Disturbances from barking dogs, livestock, or loud neighbors.
Loud music or late-night social gatherings that disrupt sleep.
General lack of maintenance, full bins, or unhygienic facilities.
Equipment is non-functional, falling apart, or very old.
Water is uncomfortably cold or the flow is too weak to use effectively.
Ground is not level, requiring ramps or causing discomfort.
Ground surface becomes difficult to manage in rain or dry weather.
The area is completely open to the sun, leading to excessive heat.
The road to the site is challenging for driving, especially for larger vans.
The site layout makes it hard to turn or position the vehicle.
The site feels too full, with vehicles parked very close together.
Pitches are small or there is no screening between neighbors.
The cost is higher than expected for the quality of services provided.
Inconvenience caused by not accepting cards or having complex payment rules.
Missing basic services such as toilets, water, or waste points.
Negative interactions with personnel that affect the experience.
Long waits for check-in or restrictive opening hours for the office.
The provided internet is slow, cuts out, or is only available in small areas.
Poor or non-existent cellular reception on the site.
Presence of suspicious individuals or known history of break-ins.
Risk of being moved on or fined by local authorities for parking.
Problems with mosquitoes, flies, or unpleasant odors from nearby industry/waste.
Noticeable rubbish left on the ground or overflowing bins.
Power hookups frequently fail or cannot handle high-draw appliances.
Water is not safe to drink or takes a very long time to fill a tank.
Hard to find the entrance or specific spots due to lack of signs.
Far from any infrastructure, requiring significant driving for basic needs.
Excessive or unwelcoming rules regarding behavior or site use.
Concerns about proximity to power lines, antennas, or cell towers.
The site is dominated by a specific social group that may make others feel unwelcome.
Access is blocked due to roadworks, events, or seasonal closures.
Facilities exist for chemical toilets but not for draining grey water tanks.
Requires specific, non-standard connectors for water or electricity that guests might not have.
Waste stations are hygienic, difficult to access, or located too close to living areas.
Other guests disrupt the experience by parking badly, being loud, or overstaying.
Physical height barriers such as low-hanging tree branches, arches, or height-restriction gates.
Parking spaces are physically too small or narrow for standard motorhomes.
Ground surface is loose sand, creating a high risk of vehicles getting stuck.
The site is extremely exposed to wind, making it uncomfortable or unsafe for awnings/roof tents.
Natural sounds (loud waves, intense wind) that are loud enough to disrupt sleep.
Any other negative feedback that does not fit into specific categories.
